perturbation.original_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.changed_text: MEMBERSHIP. The person(s) named as the Insured(s) or the Annuitant(s) is a benefit member of the Society. MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment, contingent upon board approval. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.explanation: The solvency maintenance disclosure, crucial for policyholders, is moved to be adjacent to membership details and adds the caveat 'contingent upon board approval,' obscuring its importance and potentially misleading policyholders about its implications. Solvency disclosures are intended to be clear and prominent, as they directly affect the financial security of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Insurance Regulations regarding transparency and disclosure of financial risks

perturbation.original_text: MEMBERSHIP. The person(s) named as the Insured(s) or the Annuitant(s) is a benefit member of the Society. Rights and privileges of membership are set forth in the Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society. These rights and privileges are separate from the ownership of this contract.
perturbation.changed_text: DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited. MEMBERSHIP. The person(s) named as the Insured(s) or the Annuitant(s) is a benefit member of the Society. Rights and privileges of membership are at the discretion of the Thrivent Financial Board. These rights and privileges are separate from the ownership of this contract.
perturbation.explanation: The 'MEMBERSHIP' clause is moved after the 'DIVIDENDS' clause, an unexpected location, and adding the phrase 'at the discretion of the Thrivent Financial Board' weakens members' rights, introducing ambiguity. Membership rights are typically clearly defined, not subject to arbitrary discretion.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Fraternal Benefit Society regulations regarding membership rights

perturbation.original_text: DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited.
perturbation.changed_text:
ASSIGNMENT

The ASSIGNMENT section is amended to include the following:

You may transfer ownership of this contract in accordance with our bylaws. Society membership rights and privileges cannot be transferred or assigned. DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus, though not always consistently. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited.
perturbation.explanation: The dividend disclosure is moved to after the assignment section, which might be missed by the contract holder. In addition, the phrase 'though not always consistently' is added. While dividends are not guaranteed, this phrase casts doubt on the reliability of the assessment process, misleading policyholders about the potential for receiving dividends.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Insurance regulations regarding fair and transparent disclosure of dividend policies
